description:
Dioscorea cayenensis subsp. rotundata is a subspecies of yam that belongs to the Dioscoreaceae family. It is a perennial, herbaceous, climbing vine native to West Africa.

The plant produces tubers that are round or oblong in shape, with a smooth, brown or reddish-brown skin. The tubers can reach a considerable size, typically ranging from 0.5 to 2 kilograms. The leaves are alternate, simple, and heart-shaped, with prominent veins.

Dioscorea cayenensis subsp. rotundata is an important food crop in many parts of Africa, where the tubers are a staple source of carbohydrates and nutrients. The tubers can be boiled, roasted, or processed into various food products. The plant is also known for its potential medicinal properties, with compounds found in the tubers and leaves having been studied for their antioxidant, anti-inflammatory, and hypoglycemic effects.

This subspecies is adapted to tropical and subtropical climates and thrives in well-drained, fertile soils. It is typically cultivated using vegetative propagation, with the tubers or stem cuttings used as planting material.
